title: How to Appear Busy While Using a Computer

steps.title: If you have a scheduled assignment, keep it in the taskbar and prepare to fast-click to it at a second's notice.
steps.content: If you have a scheduled assignment, keep it in the taskbar and prepare to fast-click to it at a second's notice. Alt-tab can also be useful here.

steps.title: Intersperse work with downtime by working for a few moments followed by IMing, Facebooking, Googling, or whatever it is you feel like doing.
steps.content: Intersperse work with downtime by working for a few moments followed by IMing, Facebooking, Googling, or whatever it is you feel like doing. This way you can relax and do your job, albeit slowly, at the same time.

steps.title: Write a wikiHow article on something you know about.
steps.content: Write a wikiHow article on something you know about. It looks like work, and takes a good amount of typing to do. It's a perfect cover, but won't impress your boss if you're being paid to do tasks.

steps.title: If you're at home with a laptop then try sitting with your back to a wall.
steps.content: If you're at home with a laptop then try sitting with your back to a wall. That way no one can see what you're doing. Do a lot of typing that looks productive.

steps.title: Make sure that even if you aren't doing much work, have something that looks like work open, such as an end of quarter PowerPoint or something of the sort.
steps.content: Make sure that even if you aren't doing much work, have something that looks like work open, such as an end of quarter PowerPoint or something of the sort.
